`sudo update-rc.d postfix stop 20 3 4 5 .` just says 'System startup links for /etc/init.d/postfix already exist.'
if you want to stop a service you can /etc/init.d/servicename stop
I thought that command would make it not start in runlevels 345, which is what I want
if you want to delete the service from runlevels you can update-rc.d -f postfix remove
I don't see a way to print a summary of each service's on/off setting for each runlevel
I mean putting the computer into suspend mode. when i close the lid, it just turns of the lcd. in windows it does into suspend mode.
